channel.title: Revolution Sound's Channel
channel.description:
Reggae loving soundsystem that will feed your ears with diffrent mixes and styles from our reggae archives! Mostly Roots, Dub, Rocksteady and Ska.
Dance, Skank, Rubba dubb or just relaxx to our music.
channel.itunes:subtitle: RootiCal Mixes!"
channel.itunes:author: Revolution Sound
channel.itunes:summary:
Reggae loving soundsystem that will feed your ears with diffrent mixes and styles from our reggae archives! Mostly Roots, Dub, Rocksteady and Ska.
Dance, Skank, Rubba dubb or just relaxx to our music.

item.title: 25 - Live and Love!
item.description: Just Live and love the vibes: 01 Nitty Gritty - Morning Train (Progressive 7") 02 Patrick Andy - Dont worry yourself + dub (Channel One Digikiller 10") 03 Wayne Jarrett - Live and Love (wackies 10") 04 Hugh Griffiths - Jah Bible (Ujama 7") 05 The EThiopians -You got to be clean (Merritone 7") 06 Jimmy Riley _From the ghetto (clocktower 7") 07 Alton Ellis- La la means I love you(Treasure isle 7") 08 Ken Boothe - Aint that loving you (Lee 7") 09 Pat Kelly - I dont want to go (Sunshot 7") 10 Danny Coxson - Mass Out (Gemstar DDS 7") 11 White Mice - Its a shame (Intellitec 7") 12 Horace Martin - Shock Mi a Shock (Dennis Star 7") 13 White Mice - True Love (Incredible Music 7") 14 Telephone Love - JC lodge (Music works 12") 15 Lutan Fyah - Ganja Outlaw(Fireball 7") 16 Brother Culture - RAstafari theorietcial government(One drop) 7" 17 Rocks and Mountain DUb (channel one) 10" Digikiller Celebrating life again. Shanti junior, Ella 5 month on the mic with white mice. True love! Love the life you live, live the life you love /trevor Shanti Good records check out: http://digikillerrecords.blogspot.com/ http://www.deadlydragonsound.com/ #Revolutionsound# download at revolutionsound.podomatic.com

item.title: 24 - London 48H
item.description: 48 hours of record hunting in london, mostly in Soho and Brixton, here for you is a little taste of the treasures in my london bag: 01: Jah Fondation - Anthony Chambers (Archive Recordings) 7" 02: Famine Time - Devon Russel (Globe International) 7" 03: Bad Minded - Triston Palma (Black Solidarity) 7" 04: Invasion - Jackie Edwards (Aggrovator) 7" 05: Wise Words - Al Cambell (Tuff Scout) 7" 06: Rubadub Party - J. Osborne (Coxsone) 7" 07: My Forefathers Died In The Sand - Carl Moore (Sunshot) 7" 08: That`s Not Right - Forces (Freeslaves) 7" 09: Tree Babylon - Aswad - Orginal 7" 10: It Dread In A Rome - Larry Marshall (Amanda) 7" 11: Lorna Banana - Junior Byles (Advance) 7" 12: Rockfort Psychedelion - Count Sticky & The Upsetters (Scratch) 7" 13: Wheel O´Matilda - Sowell Radics (Archive Recordings) 7" Big up London and Brixton Dub! #RevolutionSound# Jah Foundation is in the Mountains Free download at Revolutionsound.podomatic.com

item.title: 23 - Roots Session Part 3!
item.description: The third episode in our ROOT session series. Heavy Reggae Roots tracks straight to I´n I´ Head. 01 Drum intro (7" B) 02 The Rebels - Reggae Music (Brixton Sound 7") 03 Augustus Pablo - Ammagiddeon Dub (Pressure sound 7") 04 Mike Brooks - Money is not all (Fatman 7") 05 Sattatree - Babylon (One drop 7") 06 EEK A Mouse - Tell Them (Black & White 7") 07 EEk A Mouse - Land Dub (Eek A Mouse Records 7") 08 The Heptones - Mr President (Hep Hep 7") 09 The Gladiators - Time (Blackart 7") 10 Andrew Bell - Check Point (Pantomine 7") 11 Wayne Jarrett - Youthman (Pantomine 7") 12 Glenroy Richard - Wicked cant run away (Pantomine 7") 13 Keith Hudson - Rasta Country (Rasta Communication Lp) 14 Max Romeo - Tacko (Revelation Time Lp) 15 Bob Marley - Revolution (Tuff Gong Lp) 16 Horace Andy - Change your ways (clocktower lp) 17 Dennis Brown - To The Foundation (Greensleeves 7") 18 Chantells - Natty Supper (Phase One 7") 19 Alborosie - Jahnhoy (12" Maximum sound) Roots music from Shantis tree of vibes. Much love to all our listeners all over the world: Specially Brasil, Mexico, Ecuador, Ghana, south africa, japan,US, canada, Italy, france, Uk and Swe. ONE Love All over the world Wicked can´t run away ##RevolutionSound## Forward ever/ Trevor Shanti, Daddy Locks, Don Pedro and mr Inspectah Free download at: Revolutionsound.podomatic.com --

item.title: 21 - LKJ Special!
item.description:
Mi_Revalueshanary fren Mr Linton Kwesi Johnson.
The man who showed me the way to reggae music
in the early 90's.
Enjoy the sound from the Big Poet:

01 Reggae Sounds
02 Sohnnys Letter
03 Street 66
04 Time Come
05 Bass Culture
06 Fite dem Back
07 It Dread Inna Inglan (For George Lindo)
08 It Noh Funny
09 Loraine
10 Song of Blood*

All tunes from these 3 records:
Dread BeatAn'Blood (Virgin 1978) Dennis Blackbeard
*Vivian Weathers
Forces of victory ( Island 1979) Mixed by Dennis Bovell
Bass Culture (Island 1980 ) Mixed by Dennis Bovell

Linton Kwesi Johnson was born on 24 August 1952 in Chapelton, a small town in the rural parish of Clarendon,
Jamaica. He came to London in 1963
Whilst still at school he joined the Black Panthers, helped to organise a poetry workshop within the movement and developed his work with Rasta Love, a group of poets and drummers.
Johnson’s poems first appeared in the journal Race Today. In 1974 Race Today published his first collection of poetry, Voices of the Living and the Dead. Dread Beat An’ Blood, his second collection, was published in 1975 by Bogle-L’Ouverture and was also the title of his first LP, released by Virgin in 1978.
That year also saw the release of the film Dread Beat An’ Blood, a documentary on Johnson’s work.
In 1980 Race Today published his third book, Inglan Is A Bitch and there were four more albums on the Island label:
Forces of Victory (1979), Bass Culture (1980), LKJ in Dub (1981) and Making History

Forces of Victri
we're di forces af victri
an wi comin rite through
we're di forces af victri
now what yu gonna do

wi mek a likkle date
fi nineteen-seventy-eight
an wi fite an wi fite
an defeat di state
den all a wi jus fahwod
up to Not'n Hill gate
den all a wi jus fahwod
up to Not'n' Hill Gate

Verse

wi dressed in red
an wi feelin dread
wi dressed in green
an wi feelin mean
wi dressed in purple
an wi dressed in yellow
wi dressed in blue
an wi comin rite trough

##RevolutionSound##
Special dedication to Mr Inspecta's Son LINTON,
follow the fotsteps of Kwesi!

WORD, SOUND and POWER

/Trevor Shanti

item.title: 20 - Derrick Harriot and Gibbs Doing the Dub!
item.description: African DUB Set. Classic Dub tunes from Derrick Harriot and Joe Gibbs, Produced by Rocky Gibbs. In DuB We trust: 01-Queen of Sheba (Derrick Harriott) More Scrubbing The Dub 12" 02-Getto Shank (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter One 12" 03-More Scrubbing The Dub (Derrick Harriott) More Scrubbing The Dub 12" 04-Mackarus Arena (Gibbs) Arican Dub All-Mighty Chapter Two 12" 05-Smile Orange Reggae (Derrick Harriott) More Scrubbing The Dub 12" 06-Worrier (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter One 12" 07-Swinging Chariot (Derrick Harriott) More Scrubbing The Dub 12" 08-My Best Dub (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter Two 12" 09-Chapter Three (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter Three 12" 10-Roots Train (Derrick Harriott) More Scrubbing The Dub 12" 11-Idlers Rest (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter Two 12" 12-Jubalation Dub (Gibbs) African Dub All-Mighty Chapter Three 12" Cool Down The Dub for me little Woman! ------ #RevolutionSound# http://revolutionsound.podomatic.com/ rasta-revolution@hotmail.com Link UP --

item.title: 18 - Ina DJ Style!
item.description: The toasting DJs from way back in Jamaica, the style of Soundsystem Deejays toasting on the riddims to please the crowd: 01 Ital Locks - Johnny Lover (7" Clocktower) 02 Can you Keep a Secret - Big Youth (7" Mafia) 03 Diseases - Papa Michigan & General Saint (12" Greensleeves) 04 Janet Sinclair - Little John & Billy Boyo (12" Greensleeves) 05 Stop That Train - Clint Eastwood & General Saint (12" Greensleeves) 06 Ripe Cherry - Dennis Alcapone (12" Striker lee) 07 One Time Daughter - Prince Mohammed (12" Ariola) 08 Your Name and number - Earl Cunningham 09 Seven Heroes - Peter Metro (DJ Cut) 10 Tom Drunk - U-Roy feat Hopeton Lewis) (7") 11 Stop Yu Loafin - Jah Thomas (Greensleeves Lp) 12 Roughest Mc -Brigadier Jerry (On the road Lp) 13 Dread Locks Dread - Big Youth (sunshot 7") 14 DUB This version way from creation! Follow our bredren Don Pedro on his traveling tour around the globe at www.zioninc.se and link up if you live in the areas for a I&I session. Peace love and Unity, All over the Community ------------ #RevolutionSound# -- Free Download at RevolutionsSound.podomatic.com!

item.title: 17 - The Studio One Tape!
item.description: The old and dusty sound with fierce basslines and strong horn sessions from the number ONE studio at Brentford Road Kingston! Studio One with Mr Clement "Coxsone" Dodd at the controls: 01 Oh My / Ernest Ranglin (Your jamaican girl) LP 02 What Difference Does It Make (Freddy McGregor Bobby Babylon) LP 03 Searching Mind/ I`M & Dave (Your Jamican Girl) LP 04 True Experience / Prince Lincoln (Studio One Roots 2) LP 05 Journey (Burning Spear) LP 06 Jah Jah Way / Jackie Bernard (Studio One Roots 2) LP 07 In Love With You / Heptones (Ride Me Donkey) LP 08 Go Away Pretty Girl (Freddy McGregor Bobby Babylon) LP 09 Little Green Apples / Sound Dimension (Your Jamican Girl) LP 10 Consider Me v/ Jennifer Lara (Studio One Classics) Lp 11 Moving Away / Ken Boothe (Orginal Jamican Vol 3) Lp 12 Natty FarmYard / Prince Far I (Studio One Dj´s) LP 13 Natty Kung Fu / Dillinger/C.Dodd (Studio One Dj´s)LP Studio One Time !! Good Time! Jah Jah Way #RevolutionSound# Free download at Revolutionsound.podomatic.com ---------------

item.title: 16 - The 12 INCH SESSION!
item.description: Special Blend mixed exclusive for U! Stricly 12" records, a format that we love, Version excursion Yu know B.sides of life. Guest tonight with his latest purchases of 12s Mr André "Familyman" Roots!! 01 Dirty Harry - Sly Dunbar (Virgin frontline 12") 02 Jump in the line - Joe Gibbs (Joe Gibbs Records 12") 03 Gee Baby -- Al Campell (Phil Pratt 12") 04 Baby Im Yours - Investigators (Innercity 12") 05 Forward to Africa - Culture (Kingdom 12") 06 Danger light - Cultural Roots (12") 07 Dispensation - Winston Watson (Uppsetter 12") 08 Diseases - Papa Michigan and General Smiley (Greensleaves 12") 09 Police Officer - Smiley Culture (Fashion 12") 10 Children calling - Cultural Warriors (Lionpaw 12") 11 Anthony Bryan - Son of the Almighty (9recordings 12") 12 ----- Classic roots tunes meets modern DUB and DJ style, Aaand some lovers rock too, Special request Smiley Culture who died tragic a couple of month ago. FORWARD: Shanti Junior will be born i the near future now,! Celebrate Life RootsCorner RevolutionSOund crew (except Baba Shanti), spins vinyl at Restaurang Indra 27/8 NKPG. 29/9 Klubb FYAH Session, Nkpg, Dont miss the big Opening! Support the Revolution In Libya now! Peace love and Reggae music! ------------- Spread the word Download our mixes. Enjoy life --

item.title: 12 - Life Hard A Yard!!

item.title: 10 - Tribute To Mr Dennis Brown
item.description: The Crown Prince of Reggae! Born the 1 february 1957 in kingston the young prodigy recorded the singel "No man is an Island" for Sir Coxsones Dodds Studio One Label at the age of 12. He also worked as backing vocal for Horace Andy and Alton Ellis at that time. Later on in 1972 he recorded "Money in my pocket" produced by Joe Gibbs and the International succes was a fact. Hits after hit! He recorded 75 albums during his career. The Visions of Dennis Brown came through! He sadly passed away in july 1999 in Kingston,the official cause of death was a collapsed lung. 01 Whip Them Jah Jah (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 02 Song My Mother Used To Sing (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 03 No man is an island (Studio One Classics,The Original)LP 04 Im The Conqueror (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 05 Vineyard (United Dreadlocks)LP 06 No More Will I Roam (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 07 Voice Of My Father (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 08 Going To The Ball (Your Jamican Girl) LP 09 My Jamican Girl (Original Jamacian Classics vol 3) LP 10 Let me Down Easy (The Crown Prince of Reggae) LP 11 Created By The Father (The Crown Prince of Reggae) LP 12 Equal Rights (Am I Black Enogh For You?) LP 13 Children Of Israel (The Crown Prince of Reggae) Special 12" Mix 14 Rebel With A Cause (The Crown Prince of Reggae) Lp "When I write a song I try to follow Joseph's way - deliverance through vision from all - true vibration. I want to be a shepherd in my work, teaching and learning, really singing so much. I don't want to sing and not live it. I must live it. If I can sing songs that people can watch me living, then they can take my work" /Dennis Brown This Podcast is also a tribute to a newborn child named Alicia, that came to the world right in the making of the mix! Welcome! Hope you enjoy Dennis Brown Alicia Mixed by the proud Father Thomas and mother Samira Make Babies not War, as we always Say! /Shanti #RevolutionSound# Jah Live
item.dc:creator: Revolution Sound
item.itunes:summary:
The Crown Prince of Reggae!
Born the 1 february 1957 in kingston the young prodigy recorded the singel "No man is an Island" for Sir Coxsones Dodds Studio One Label at the age of 12. He also worked as backing vocal for Horace Andy and Alton Ellis at that time.
Later on in 1972 he recorded "Money in my pocket" produced by Joe Gibbs and the International succes was a fact. Hits after hit! He recorded 75 albums during his career. The Visions of Dennis Brown came through! He sadly passed away in july 1999 in Kingston,the official cause of death was a collapsed lung.
01 Whip Them Jah Jah (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 02 Song My Mother Used To Sing (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 03 No man is an island (Studio One Classics,The Original)LP 04 Im The Conqueror (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 05 Vineyard (United Dreadlocks)LP 06 No More Will I Roam (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 07 Voice Of My Father (The Crown Prince of Reggae)LP 08 Going To The Ball (Your Jamican Girl) LP 09 My Jamican Girl (Original Jamacian Classics vol 3) LP 10 Let me Down Easy (The Crown Prince of Reggae) LP 11 Created By The Father (The Crown Prince of Reggae) LP 12 Equal Rights (Am I Black Enogh For You?) LP 13 Children Of Israel (The Crown Prince of Reggae) Special 12" Mix 14 Rebel With A Cause (The Crown Prince of Reggae) Lp
"When I write a song I try to follow Joseph's way - deliverance through vision from all - true vibration. I want to be a shepherd in my work, teaching and learning, really singing so much. I don't want to sing and not live it. I must live it. If I can sing songs that people can watch me living, then they can take my work" /Dennis Brown
This Podcast is also a tribute to a newborn child named Alicia, that came to the world right in the making of the mix! Welcome! Hope you enjoy Dennis Brown Alicia Mixed by the proud Father Thomas and mother Samira
Make Babies not War, as we always Say! /Shanti
#RevolutionSound# Jah Live

item.title: 09 - STOP WAR, Riddim of life!
item.description: Stop the War! Support the Revolutions down in Northern Africa. Let the Tunes speak: 01 War and Friction - I Roy (Dread,Baldhead, LackPot LP) 02 Stop the Tribal war - Johnny Clarke (Rockers time, Lackpot LP) 03 Tribal War - Black Roots (In session, BBC LP) 04 Revolution - Bob Marley (Natty Dread, tuff Gong LP) 05 Revolution - Dennis Brown (Taxi 12") 06 In Pieces Dub - Don Carlos (Firehouse 7") 07 One step Forward - Max romeo (War ina babylon, Uppsetter Lp) 08 Killer Man Jaro - Dillinger (Ready Natty Dready, Studio one Lp) 09 Daughters of Babylon - Jimmy Lindsey(GEM 12") 10 This world - Leroy Sibbles (Bullwackies 12") 11 Man From africa - Shaka Ridim Selection (Jah Shaka Music 12") Tunis, Egypt,Libya,Bahrain, Jemen, Algeria, Iran... All freedom Fighters! Let the Riddim of life Begin! To our friends in Japan, We support you in the Struggle against the Nuclear Disaster and Tsunami. War is Ugly, Love is Lovely #RevolutionSound# CovertArt by Mr ANdré /TrevorShanti

item.title: 07 - Hugh Mundell Tribute
item.description:
The Blessed Youth Hugh Mundell recorded his first album "Africa Must Be Free By 1983" at the age of 16. He recorded 5 albums and several 12" and 7" during his short time on earth. Hugh also started his own Label "Muni-Musik", Also known as DJ Jah Levi on his friend  Augustus Pablos Soundsystem..
He tragical got shoot 1983 while driving with Junior Reid. 
Hugh Mundells lives on today  through his voice and musical skills:

01 - Let´s all Unite - Rockers 7"
02 - Oh how I love HIM - Time and place Lp
03 - Jah will Provide - Rockers 7"
04 - Tell I a lie - MUNDELL Lp
05 - Time and place - Time and place Lp
06 - Going places - MUNDELL Lp
07 - Live in love - Time and place Lp
08 - Jacqueline - MUNDELL Lp
09 - Dont stay away to long - Rockers 7"
10 - Rasta have to handle - Mundell Lp

You should definitly pick up these two LPs if you enjoy Mundell as much as I do:
Time and place Mun Rock 1980,
co prod Augustus Pablo also on instruments with Leroy Horsemouth.
Mundell Greensleves 1982, #GREL 36
Recorded at channel one studio, mixed by Scientist at King tubbys
Backed by Roots radics Band.

Hugh Mundell 1962 - 1983
Known as Jah Levi, The Blessed Youth

Nature Provides Everything in Life
#RevolutionSound#

item.title: 06 - Never Step on the Rastaman!
item.description:
Some nice Deep Roots tunes Rastaman Stylee!
"Iam a Revolutionist, I man not deal with capitalism, I am a rastaman" / McGregor

Intro by Mr Bob Marley
1. I Am a Revolutionist-Freddie Mc.Gregor (STUDIO 1) LP
2. Roots Natty-Gladiators (STUDIO 1) LP
3. Children of Jah-The Chantells (PHASE 1) LP
4. Natty Rootsman-Barry Brown (Kingston Sounds) LP
5. Trod With Jah Jah-Barrington Levy (JAH LIFE) LP
6. Hail H.I.M-Burning Spear (Jamaica original) LP
7. Behold The Land-Culture (APRIL Records) LP
8. Creation-Burning Spear (STUDIO 1) LP
9. Run Babylon-Larry Marshall (STUDIO 1 Roots 2) LP
10.Rastaman Camp-Freddie Mc.Gregor (STUDIO 1) Lp

It Takes a Revolution to make a Solution

#RevolutionSound#

Comment or Request your favorite Tunes, Become a follower and
Up to date!  Bless

Mixed by Poffen
CoverArt by Mr ANdré
Niceee

item.title: 05 - Andre Roots Selection
item.description:
This time we had a guest with his pockets full of nice tunes, Mr Andre Roots.
Backed Up by Revolution Sound with some nice Dubs from Twinkle Brothers and Clocktower,
Step Forward Selecta:

01. People a watch me - Johnny Osbourne (Studio 1 7")
02. Where can I lay my weary head - The flaming arrow (Sunshot 7")
03. Roman Soldier - Freddie Mcgregor (Observer 7")
04. Roots man - I-ROY (Observer 7")
05. Trodding through the Jungle - C Livingstone (Volcano 7")
06. Woman is like a shadow - The Meditations (Danja records 7")
07. Rainy day stormy night - Daddy Shark (Midnight rock 7")
08. Excuse me - Nitty Gritty (Thriller 7")
09. Marcus - Leroy smart (Best of, Channel One)
10. Marcus Garvey - The Twinkle Brother(The right way, Jah Shaka LP)
11. African Monica - W Wade (VA LP Abraham)
12. See the dread Deh - Rupert Reid (Junior Byles and friends, Blood and fire Lp)
13. Nattys rude dub - Conquers in Dub (Clocktower lp)
14. The right Dub - Twinkel Brothers (Jah Shaka lp)

 DuB the Life You Love!
Love the Life you DuB!

One Love
#RevolutionSound#

CoverArt by Mr ANdre

item.title: 04 - Ooman Session!
item.description: Yes, Special Dedication To all Woman! So many good reggae tunes about love of Ooman and mr romantic dread.. I picked out some of them for tonight. Lean back and relax or dance with tha women. I Inspired By my lovely Lady M. Love is Lovely, War IS Ugly! .. 01. Love of a woman - Horace Andy (Skylarking, studio 1 LP) 02. Jamaican Woman - Don Carlos (Them never know Natty Dread, Channel One LP) 03. Cool down the pase - Gregory Isaacs (Night Nurse, African Museum LP) 04. Lilly of the Valley - Ijahman Levi (Lilly of the valley, Tree roots records Lp) 05. Rockabye Woman - Freddie Mckay (Hotrod 7") 06. Miserable Woman - Tristan Palmer (Showcase, vista-Sounds LP) 07. Love Feelings - Cultural Roots (Hell a go pop, Greensleeves LP) 08. She want me to cry - Little John (Early days, Roots Tradition Lp) 09. Come Back darling - Sammy Dread (Road Block, Channel One LP) 10. African Queen - Prince Far I (Umkhonto We Sizwe, Wambesi Lp) 11. Let your Tear drops fall - Sugar minott (Sonic Sound LP) 12. In your Eyes - Johnny Osbourne (Jah Guidance 7") 13. Love to see you smile - Delroy Wilson (Best of, Channel one LP) 14. Love knows no shame - Glen Washington (Brother to Brother, Studio 1 LP) 15. How Can I leave you - The Heptones (Studio 1 7") The love of a woman is all I can take The love of a woman is all I can keep The art of a woman is all I can steel, I did it two times Already, /Horace Andy Peace, Love and Unity all over the Community!! #Revolution Sound# CoverArt by ANdre

item.title: 03 - Alton Ellis Special!
item.description: My top Ten songs from the very special Mr ALTON ELLIS. The Godfather of Rocksteady (September 1, 1938 – October 10 2008). One of my all time favorites. Enjoy! 1. If I could rule the world, Mr soul of jamaica, treasure Isle. 2. Altons offical daughter, Aquarius 7". 3. You make me happy/I´ve lost that love, Treasure Isle 7". 4. I´ll be waiting, Im still in love with you,Coxsone lp. 5. Why Birds follow spring, Mr soul of Jamaica, Treasure Isle lp. 6. Its True , Sunday Coming, Studio One Lp. 7. To Late to turn Back now, Impact 7". 8. Reasons in the sky, Sunday Coming lp. 9. Chatty Chatty , Mr Soul of jamaica lp. 10. To Win Your love , Sunday Coming lp. U better get ready to rocksteady! #Revolution Sound#

item.description: Enjoy it with coffe and sugar on lazy Skanking sundays... 01 - Police & Thieves - John Courtney (Sweet Beat) 7" 02 - Justice For all - Natty G Wailing Soul (Sweet Beat) 7" 03 - Set Up Yourself - Ferris Thomas (Joe Gibbs) 12" 04 - Sweet Suger Plum Plum - Wailing Soul (Taxi Oldies) 7" 05 - The Creator - George Nooks (Joe Gibbs) 12" 06 - African Teacher - Burnings Spears (Orginal) lp 07 - Monday - Black Uhuru (Island) lp 08 - Soon Forward - Gregory Isaacs (Taxi Oldies) 7" 09 - Hard Road To Travel - Jimmy Cliff (Island) lp 10 - Don`t Look Back - Peter Tosh Maxi lp 11 - Smoking My Ganja - Capital Letters (Greensleeves) lp 12 - Your House - Steal Pulse (genlyd) lp 13 - Blood Against Blood - Ras David (Nocturnal Pro.) 7" 14 - Cry Blood African - Burnings Spears (Orginal) lp Leave a comment, send suggestions for your favorite tunes or themes! spread the word. Natty Congo +version - Johnny Clarke, Clocktower 12
Mo fire #Revolution Sound#
